title.narrative: 2.1.1: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) NORMS AND STANDARS

description.narrative: By 2016, CAR has regulatory norms and standards and action plans for the effective implementation of drinking water supply and sanitation at individual and community levels., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, in the provinces of the country showing poorest access and coverage of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, at least 50% of the population accesses potable water and basic sanitation and implements good hygiene practices.

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, CAR has regulatory norms and standards and action plans for the effective implementation of drinking water supply and sanitation at individual and community levels.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided enhanced support to the government in humanitarian and non-humanitarian related WASH sector interventions in building institutions and capacities in fragile contexts. WASH sector was well positioned on the national agenda and priorities through the contribution of UNICEF to the implementation and result monitoring of the RCPCA programme document. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018
